00027 void DetectorAnomaly()
00028 {
00029    Kinema->cd();
00030  
00031    TF1 *expf = new TF1("expf", "expo");
00032 
00033    expf->SetParameters(1, -60);
00034    expf->SetLineColor(2);
00035  
00036    // limit fitting range between energy cuts. Be careful to change this
00037    // not to include small entry bins at the both edge of the histogram
00038    // into the fit.
00039    //ds: extern StructHist Eslope;
00040    float dbin  = (Eslope.xmax - Eslope.xmin)/float(Eslope.nxbin);
00041    float min_t = 2 * 400 * MASS_12C * k2G * k2G + dbin;
00042    float max_t = 2 * 900 * MASS_12C * k2G * k2G - dbin;
00043 
00044    energy_spectrum_all->Fit("expf", " ", " ", min_t, max_t);
00045 
00046    gAnaMeasResult->energy_slope[0] = expf->GetParameter(1);
00047    gAnaMeasResult->energy_slope[1] = expf->GetParError(1);
00048  
00049    // print fitting results on histogram
00050    char text[36];
00051 
00052    sprintf(text, "slope=%6.1f +/- %6.2f", gAnaMeasResult->energy_slope[0], gAnaMeasResult->energy_slope[1]);
00053 
00054    TText *t = new TText(0.01, energy_spectrum_all->GetMaximum()/4, text);
00055 
00056    energy_spectrum_all->GetListOfFunctions()->Add(t);
00057 }

00060 // Description : Check the Mass vs. 12C Kinetic Enegy Correlation. Apply linear fit on
00061 //             : Mass .vs Energy scatter plot and record resulting slops for all strips
00062 void InvariantMassCorrelation(int st)
00063 {
00064    Kinema->cd();
00065  
00066    char htitle[100],histname[100];
00067  
00068    // Function for Fitting
00069    TF1 *g1 = new TF1("g1","gaus",5,16);
00070    TF1 *f1 = new TF1("f1","pol1",200,1000);
00071    f1->SetLineColor(2);
00072  
00073    // Mass vs. Energy correlation
00074    sprintf(histname,"mass_vs_e_ecut_st%d",st+1);
00075    mass_vs_e_ecut[st]->Write();
00076    TH2F * hslice = (TH2F*) gDirectory->Get(histname);
00077    hslice->SetName("hslice");
00078  
00079    // slice histogram for fit
00080    hslice->FitSlicesY(g1);
00081  
00082    TH1D *hslice_1 = (TH1D*)gDirectory->Get("hslice_1");
00083    sprintf(histname,"mass_vs_energy_corr_st%d",st+1);
00084    hslice_1 -> SetName(histname);
00085    sprintf(htitle,"%.3f:Invariant Mass vs. Energy Correlation Fit (Str%d)",gMeasInfo->RUNID,st+1);
00086    hslice_1 -> SetTitle(htitle);
00087    hslice_1 -> GetXaxis()->SetTitle("12C Kinetic Energy [keV]");
00088    hslice_1 -> GetYaxis()->SetTitle("Invariant Mass [GeV]");
00089    hslice_1 -> Fit("f1","Q");
00090    TLine * l = new TLine(200, 1000, MASS_12C*k2G, MASS_12C*k2G);
00091    hslice_1 -> GetListOfFunctions() -> Add(l);
00092  
00093    //Get Fitting results
00094    for (int j=0;j<2; j++) {
00095       strpchk.ecorr.p[j][st]    = f1->GetParameter(j);
00096       strpchk.ecorr.perr[j][st] = strpchk.ecorr.p[j][st] != 0 ? f1->GetParError(j) : 0;
00097    }
00098  
00099    // Delete unnecessary histograms generated by FitSliceY();
00100    TH1D *hslice_0 = (TH1D*)gDirectory->Get("hslice_0");
00101    TH1D *hslice_2 = (TH1D*)gDirectory->Get("hslice_2");
00102    TH1D *hslice_chi2 = (TH1D*)gDirectory->Get("hslice_chi2");
00103    hslice_0->Delete(); hslice_2->Delete(); hslice_chi2->Delete();
00104  
00105    // Make graph of p1 paramter as a function of strip number when strip number is the last one
00106    if (st == NSTRIP-1) {
00107       ErrDet->cd();
00108  
00109       float strip[NSTRIP],ex[NSTRIP];
00110       for (int k=0;k<NSTRIP;k++) {strip[k]=k+1;ex[k]=0;}
00111  
00112       float min,max;
00113       float margin=0.2;
00114       GetMinMaxOption(strpchk.p1.allowance*1.5, NBUNCH, strpchk.ecorr.p[1], margin, min, max);
00115       sprintf(htitle,"Run%.3f : P[1] distribution for Mass vs. Energy Correlation", gMeasInfo->RUNID);
00116       mass_e_correlation_strip = new TH2F("mass_e_correlation_strip", htitle, NSTRIP+1, 0, NSTRIP+1, 50, min, max);
00117       TGraphErrors * mass_e_gr = AsymmetryGraph(1, NSTRIP, strip, strpchk.ecorr.p[1], ex, strpchk.ecorr.perr[1]);
00118       mass_e_gr -> SetName("mass_e_gr");
00119       mass_e_correlation_strip -> GetListOfFunctions() -> Add(mass_e_gr,"p");
00120       mass_e_correlation_strip -> GetXaxis()->SetTitle("Strip Number");
00121       mass_e_correlation_strip -> GetYaxis()->SetTitle("slope [GeV/keV]");
00122       DrawHorizLine(mass_e_correlation_strip, 0, NSTRIP+1,  strpchk.p1.allowance, 2, 2, 2);
00123       DrawHorizLine(mass_e_correlation_strip, 0, NSTRIP+1, -strpchk.p1.allowance, 2, 2, 2);
00124    }
00125 }

00128 // Description : fit banana with kinematic function. This routine is incomplete.
00129 //             : 1. fix hard corded runconst.E2T consntant 1459.43.
00130 //             : 2. delete hbananan_1 histograms
00131 void BananaFit(int st)
00132 {
00133    char f[50];
00134    sprintf(f,"%8.3f/sqrt(x)", gRunConsts[st+1].E2T);
00135    TF1 * functof = new TF1("functof", f,200,1500);
00136    functof->SetLineColor(2);
00137    functof->SetLineWidth(4);
00138    functof->SetName("kin_func");
00139    functof->Write();
00140  
00141    char hname[100];
00142    sprintf(hname,"t_vs_e_st%d",st);
00143    t_vs_e[st]->GetListOfFunctions()->Add(functof);
00144    t_vs_e[st]->Write();
00145    TH2F * hbanana = (TH2F*) gDirectory->Get(hname);
00146    hbanana->SetName("hbanana");
00147  
00148    // Get centers of banana
00149    hbanana->FitSlicesY();
00150  
00151    TH1D *hbanana_1 = (TH1D*) gDirectory->Get("hbanana_1");
00152    sprintf(hname,"banana_center_st%d",st);
00153    hbanana_1->SetName(hname);
00154  
00155    // Delete unnecessary histograms
00156    TH1D *hbanana_0    = (TH1D*) gDirectory->Get("hbanana_0");
00157    TH1D *hbanana_2    = (TH1D*) gDirectory->Get("hbanana_2");
00158    TH1D *hbanana_chi2 = (TH1D*) gDirectory->Get("hbanana_chi2");
00159    hbanana_0->Delete();  hbanana_2->Delete();  hbanana_chi2->Delete();
00160 }

00163 // Description : find suspicious strips through folllowing three checks
00164 //             : (chi-2 check of Gaussian Fit on Inviariant Mass is not included now)
00165 //             : strip_err_code (1111)
00166 //             : Bit[0]: RMS width of Carbin Invariant Mass Deviation from Average
00167 //             : Bit[1]: Maximum deviation of invariant mass peak from 12Mass
00168 //             : Bit[2]: Number of events in Banana Cuts Deviation from Average
00169 //             : Bit[3]: Invariant Mass vs. Energy Correlation
00170 void StripAnomalyDetector()
00171 {
00172    // Errror allowance
00173    strpchk.p1.allowance    = errdet.MASS_ENERGY_CORR_ALLOWANCE;
00174    strpchk.dev.allowance   = errdet.MASS_POSITION_ALLOWANCE;
00175    strpchk.width.allowance = errdet.MASS_WIDTH_DEV_ALLOWANCE;
00176    strpchk.chi2.allowance  = errdet.MASS_CHI2_ALLOWANCE;
00177    strpchk.evnt.allowance  = errdet.GOOD_CARBON_EVENTS_ALLOWANCE;
00178  
00179    // Get weighted average for width of 12C invariant mass distributions
00180    strpchk.width.average[0] = utils::WeightedMean((Double_t*) feedback.RMS, (Double_t*) feedback.err,NSTRIP);
00181    DrawHorizLine(mass_sigma_vs_strip, 0, NSTRIP+1, strpchk.width.average[0], 1, 1, 2);
00182  
00183    // Calculate average carbon events in banana cuts
00184    strpchk.evnt.average[0] = good_carbon_events_strip->GetEntries()/float(gMeasInfo->GetNumActiveSiChannels());
00185    DrawHorizLine(good_carbon_events_strip, 0.5, NSTRIP+0.5, strpchk.evnt.average[0], 1, 1, 2);
00186    printf(" Average # of Events in Banana Cut : %6.2f\n", strpchk.evnt.average[0]);
00187  
00188    // initiarization before following worst (max) search
00189    strpchk.dev.max  = 0;
00190    strpchk.chi2.max = 0;
00191    strpchk.evnt.max = 0;
00192  
00193    // registration of the worst strips
00194    float evntdev[NSTRIP];
00195    float sigma=0;
00196    int counter=0;
00197  
00198    for (int i=0; i<NSTRIP; i++) {
00199       evntdev[i] = 0;
00200       printf("Anomary Check for strip=%d ...\r", i);
00201  
00202       if (!gMeasInfo->IsDisabledChannel(i+1)) {
00203          // t vs. Energy (this routine is incomplete)
00204          //BananaFit(i);
00205  
00206          // MASS vs. Energy correlation
00207          InvariantMassCorrelation(i);
00208  
00209          if (!i) strpchk.p1.max = fabs(double(strpchk.ecorr.p[1][i]));  // initialize max w/ strip 0
00210  
00211          if (fabs(double(strpchk.ecorr.p[1][i])) > fabs(double(strpchk.p1.max)) ) {
00212            strpchk.p1.max = strpchk.ecorr.p[1][i];
00213            strpchk.p1.st  = i;
00214          }
00215  
00216          // Maximum devistion of peak from 12C_MASS
00217          if ((fabs(feedback.mdev[i]) > strpchk.dev.max)&&(feedback.mdev[i]!=ASYM_DEFAULT)) {
00218            strpchk.dev.max  = feedback.mdev[i];
00219            strpchk.dev.st   = i;
00220          }
00221  
00222          // Gaussian Mass fit Largest chi2
00223          if (feedback.chi2[i] > strpchk.chi2.max) {
00224            strpchk.chi2.max  = fabs(double(feedback.chi2[i]));
00225            strpchk.chi2.st   = i;
00226          }
00227  
00228          // Good carbon events within banana
00229          evntdev[i]=fabs(double(good_carbon_events_strip->GetBinContent(i+1)-strpchk.evnt.average[0]))/strpchk.evnt.average[0] ;
00230  
00231          if (evntdev[i]>strpchk.evnt.max) {
00232            strpchk.evnt.max  = evntdev[i];
00233            strpchk.evnt.st   = i;
00234          }
00235  
00236          // Calculate one sigma of RMS distribution
00237          if (feedback.err[i]){
00238            sigma += (feedback.RMS[i]-strpchk.width.average[0])*(feedback.RMS[i]-strpchk.width.average[0])
00239              /feedback.err[i]/feedback.err[i];
00240            counter++;
00241          }
00242       }
00243    }
00244  
00245    sigma=sqrt(sigma)/counter;
00246  
00247    // Draw lines to objects
00248    float widthlimit=strpchk.width.allowance+strpchk.width.average[0];
00249    DrawHorizLine(mass_sigma_vs_strip, 0, NSTRIP+1, widthlimit, 2, 2, 2);
00250  
00251    float chi2limit={strpchk.chi2.allowance};
00252    DrawHorizLine(mass_chi2_vs_strip, 0, NSTRIP+1, chi2limit, 2, 2, 2);
00253  
00254    // draw average line for 12C mass width distribution
00255    DrawHorizLine(mass_pos_dev_vs_strip, 0, NSTRIP+1,    strpchk.dev.allowance, 2, 2, 2);
00256    DrawHorizLine(mass_pos_dev_vs_strip, 0, NSTRIP+1, -1*strpchk.dev.allowance, 2, 2, 2);
00257  
00258    // draw allowance for good_carbon_events_strip
00259    float evelim=(1+strpchk.evnt.allowance)*strpchk.evnt.average[0];
00260    DrawHorizLine(good_carbon_events_strip, 0.5, NSTRIP+0.5, evelim, 2, 2, 2);
00261    evelim=(1-strpchk.evnt.allowance)*strpchk.evnt.average[0];
00262    DrawHorizLine(good_carbon_events_strip, 0.5, NSTRIP+0.5, evelim, 2, 2, 2);
00263  
00264    // register and count suspicious strips
00265    gAnaMeasResult->anomaly.nstrip = 0;
00266    gAnaMeasResult->anomaly.strip_err_code = 0;
00267  
00268    char text[36];
00269  
00270    for (int i=0;i<NSTRIP; i++) {
00271  
00272       sprintf(text, "%2d", i+1);
00273       int strip_err_code = 0;
00274  
00275       if (!gMeasInfo->IsDisabledChannel(i+1)) { // process only if the strip is active
00276  
00277          // deviation from average width of 12C mass distribution
00278          if (fabs(double(feedback.RMS[i]))-strpchk.width.average[0]>strpchk.width.allowance) {
00279             strip_err_code += 1;
00280             printf(" WARNING: strip # %d Mass width %8.4f exeeds allowance limit %8.4f\n",
00281                    i+1, feedback.RMS[i], strpchk.width.allowance);
00282             DrawText(mass_sigma_vs_strip, float(i+1), feedback.RMS[i], 2, text);
00283          }
00284  
00285          // Invariant mass peak position deviation from 12C mass
00286          if (fabs(double(feedback.mdev[i])) > fabs(double(strpchk.dev.allowance))) {
00287             strip_err_code += 2;
00288             printf(" WARNING: strip # %d Mass position deviation %8.4f exeeds allowance limit %8.4f\n",
00289                    i+1, feedback.mdev[i], strpchk.dev.allowance);
00290             DrawText(mass_pos_dev_vs_strip, float(i+1), feedback.mdev[i], 2, text);
00291          }
00292  
00293          // number of carbon events per strip checker
00294          if (evntdev[i] > strpchk.evnt.allowance) {
00295             strip_err_code += 4;
00296             printf(" WARNING: strip # %d number of events in banana cut  %6.2f exeeds allowance limit %6.2f\n",
00297                    i+1, evntdev[i], strpchk.evnt.allowance);
00298             // comment in h2 histogram
00299             DrawText(good_carbon_events_strip, float(i+1), good_carbon_events_strip->GetBinContent(i+1), 2, text);
00300          }
00301  
00302          // mass vs. 12C kinetic energy correlation
00303          if (fabs(double(strpchk.ecorr.p[1][i])) > strpchk.p1.allowance) {
00304             strip_err_code += 8;
00305             printf(" WARNING: strip # %d Mass-Energy Correlation %8.4f exeeds allowance limit %8.4f\n",
00306                    i+1, strpchk.ecorr.p[1][i],strpchk.p1.allowance);
00307             DrawText(mass_e_correlation_strip, float(i+1), strpchk.ecorr.p[1][i], 2, text);
00308          }
00309  
00310          if (strip_err_code) {
00311             gAnaMeasResult->anomaly.st[gAnaMeasResult->anomaly.nstrip]=i;
00312             ++gAnaMeasResult->anomaly.nstrip;
00313          }
00314  
00315          // register global strip error code
00316          gAnaMeasResult->anomaly.strip_err_code = gAnaMeasResult->anomaly.strip_err_code | strip_err_code ;
00317       }
00318    }
00319 }

00322 // Description : find suspicious bunch thru Gaussian fit on bunch asymmetry histograms
00323 //             : the bunches deviates more than sigma from fitted Gaussian width will be
00324 //             : registered as problematic bunch ID
00325 // Input       : TH1F * h1, TH2F * h2, float A[], float dA[], int err_code
00326 // Return      : sigma of Gaussian fit
00327 //
00328 float BunchAsymmetryGaussianFit(TH1F * h1, TH2F * h2, float A[], float dA[], int err_code)
00329 {
00330   // define Gaussian function
00331   TF1 *g = new TF1("g","gaus");
00332 
00333   g->SetLineColor(2);
00334 
00335   // Perform Gaussian Fit
00336   h1->Fit("g", "Q");
00337 
00338   //float hight = g->GetParameter(0);
00339   float mean  = g->GetParameter(1);
00340   float sigma = g->GetParameter(2);
00341 
00342   // get sigma from Gaussian fit and calculate allowance limit
00343   //  bnchchk.asym[0].allowance = mean - errdet.BUNCH_ASYM_SIGMA_ALLOWANCE*sigma;
00344   //  bnchchk.asym[1].allowance = mean + errdet.BUNCH_ASYM_SIGMA_ALLOWANCE*sigma;
00345 
00346   // draw lines to mean asymmetery vs. bunch histograms
00347   DrawHorizLine(h2, -0.5, NBUNCH-0.5,  mean, 4, 4, 2);
00348   DrawHorizLine(h2, -0.5, NBUNCH-0.5, -mean, 2, 2, 2);
00349 
00350   // axis titles
00351   h1->GetYaxis()->SetTitle("Counts devided by statistical error");
00352   h1->GetXaxis()->SetTitle("Raw Asymmetry");
00353 
00354   // local anamaly bunch array and counter
00355   struct StructBUNCH {
00356      float A[NBUNCH];
00357      int   bunch[NBUNCH];
00358      int   nbunch;
00359      float dev;
00360      int   active_bunch[2];
00361      float chi2[2]; // [0]:plus [1]:minus bunches
00362   } local;
00363 
00364   // Anomaly bunch finding
00365   char text[20];
00366 
00367   local.nbunch  = local.active_bunch[0] = local.active_bunch[1] = 0;
00368   local.chi2[0] = local.chi2[1] = 0;
00369 
00370   for (int bid=0;bid<NBUNCH;bid++) {
00371     local.bunch[bid] = -999; // default not to appear in plots
00372 
00373     if ( !gMeasInfo->IsEmptyBunch(bid+1) && A[bid] != -ASYM_DEFAULT ) {
00374 
00375       if (gMeasInfo->GetBunchSpin(bid) == 1) {
00376         local.active_bunch[0]++;
00377         local.dev =  fabs(double(A[bid] - mean));
00378         local.chi2[0] += local.dev*local.dev/dA[bid]/dA[bid];
00379       }
00380 
00381       if (gMeasInfo->GetBunchSpin(bid) == -1) {
00382         local.active_bunch[1]++;
00383         local.dev =  fabs(double(A[bid] - (-1)*mean));
00384         local.chi2[1] += local.dev*local.dev/dA[bid]/dA[bid];
00385       }
00386 
00387       if (local.dev/dA[bid] > errdet.BUNCH_ASYM_SIGMA_ALLOWANCE) {
00388 
00389          local.bunch[local.nbunch] = bid;
00390          local.A[local.nbunch] = A[bid];
00391          local.nbunch++;
00392          printf(" WARNING: bunch # %d asym sigma %6.1f exeeds %6.1f limit from average\n",
00393                 bid, local.dev/dA[bid], errdet.BUNCH_ASYM_SIGMA_ALLOWANCE);
00394 
00395          // comment in h2 histogram
00396          sprintf(text,"%6.1f sigma (%d)", local.dev/dA[bid],bid);
00397          TText * t = new TText(bid+2, A[bid], text);
00398          h2 -> GetListOfFunctions()->Add(t);
00399       }
00400     }
00401   }
00402 
00403   // print chi2 in plot
00404   sprintf(text,"chi2(+)=%6.1f", local.chi2[0]/float(local.active_bunch[0]));
00405   TText * t1 = new TText(3, h2->GetYaxis()->GetXmax()*0.90, text);
00406   t1->SetTextColor(13);
00407   h2 -> GetListOfFunctions()->Add(t1);
00408   sprintf(text,"chi2(-)=%6.1f", local.chi2[1]/float(local.active_bunch[1]));
00409   TText * t2 = new TText(90, h2->GetYaxis()->GetXmin()*0.90, text);
00410   t2->SetTextColor(13);
00411   h2 -> GetListOfFunctions()->Add(t2);
00412 
00413   if (local.nbunch) {
00414      // error_code registration
00415      gAnaMeasResult->anomaly.bunch_err_code += err_code;
00416 
00417      // global registration
00418      RegisterAnomaly(local.bunch, local.nbunch, gAnaMeasResult->anomaly.bunch, gAnaMeasResult->anomaly.nbunch,
00419                      gAnaMeasResult->anomaly.bunch, gAnaMeasResult->anomaly.nbunch);
00420 
00421      // Superpose h2 histogram
00422      float bindex[local.nbunch];
00423 
00424      for (int i=0; i<local.nbunch; i++) bindex[i] = local.bunch[i];
00425 
00426      TGraph * gr = new TGraph(local.nbunch, bindex, local.A);
00427      gr->SetMarkerStyle(24);
00428      gr->SetMarkerSize(MSIZE);
00429      gr->SetMarkerColor(3);
00430 
00431      // append suspicious bunch in h2 hitogram
00432      h2->GetListOfFunctions() -> Add(gr,"P");
00433   }
00434 
00435   return sigma;
00436 }

00439 // Description : find suspicious bunch thru Gaussian fit on bunch asymmetry histograms
00440 //             : the bunches deviates more than sigma from fitted Gaussian width will be
00441 //             : registered as problematic bunch ID.
00442 //             : The last argument of the function BunchAsymmetryGaussianFit() is the
00443 //             : error code to record which asymmetry gives warning.
00444 void BunchAsymmetryAnomaly()
00445 {
00446    // X90 Asymmetry Check
00447    printf("BunchAsymmetryAnomaly(): check for x90\n");
00448    bnchchk.asym[0].sigma =
00449       BunchAsymmetryGaussianFit(asym_bunch_x90, asym_vs_bunch_x90, gBunchAsym.Ax90[0], gBunchAsym.Ax90[1], 1);
00450 
00451    // X45 Asymmetry Check
00452    printf("BunchAsymmetryAnomaly(): check for x45\n");
00453    bnchchk.asym[1].sigma =
00454       BunchAsymmetryGaussianFit(asym_bunch_x45, asym_vs_bunch_x45, gBunchAsym.Ax45[0], gBunchAsym.Ax45[1], 2);
00455 
00456    // Y45 Asymmetry Check
00457    printf("BunchAsymmetryAnomaly(): check for y45\n");
00458    bnchchk.asym[2].sigma =
00459       BunchAsymmetryGaussianFit(asym_bunch_y45, asym_vs_bunch_y45, gBunchAsym.Ay45[0], gBunchAsym.Ay45[1], 4);
00460 }

00463 // Description : finds suspicious bunch thru following two checks of bunch by bunch
00464 //             : Asymmetry anomaly check
00465 //             : counting rate anomaly check
00466 void BunchAnomalyDetector()
00467 {
00468    // Initialize anomaly bunch counter and error_code
00469    gAnaMeasResult->anomaly.nbunch= gMeasInfo->GetNumFilledBunches() > errdet.NBUNCH_REQUIREMENT ? 0 : -1 ;
00470    gAnaMeasResult->anomaly.bunch_err_code = 0;
00471    bnchchk.rate.max_dev = 0;
00472 
00473    if (gAnaMeasResult->anomaly.nbunch != -1) {
00474       // Find anomaly bunches from unusual deviation from average asymmetry
00475       BunchAsymmetryAnomaly();
00476 
00477       // Find Hot bunches from counting rates per bunch
00478       HotBunchFinder(8);
00479 
00480       // check unrecognized anomaly
00481       //UnrecognizedAnomaly(gAnaMeasResult->anomaly.bunch, gAnaMeasResult->anomaly.nbunch, gMeasInfo->DisableBunch,gMeasInfo->NDisableBunch,
00482       //                  gAnaMeasResult->unrecog.anomaly.bunch, gAnaMeasResult->unrecog.anomaly.nbunch);
00483 
00484       gAnaMeasResult->anomaly.bad_bunch_rate = gMeasInfo->GetNumFilledBunches() ? gAnaMeasResult->anomaly.nbunch/float(gMeasInfo->GetNumFilledBunches())*100 : -1 ;
00485    }
00486 }
00487 
00488 
00489 // Description : find hot bunch from specific luminosity distribution
00490 // Input       : err_code
00491 void HotBunchFinder(int err_code)
00492 {
00493    float bindex[NBUNCH];
00494    float max = FLT_MIN, min = FLT_MAX;
00495    int init_flag=1;
00496    int EXCLUDE_BUNCH=20; // bunch 20 supposed be excluded from specific luminosity anomaly finding
00497  
00498    for (int bnch=0; bnch<NBUNCH; bnch++) {
00499  
00500       // inistiarization
00501       bindex[bnch] = bnch;
00502  
00503       // calculate min and max range of the histogram
00504       if ((SpeLumi.Cnts[bnch])&&(init_flag) ) {min=SpeLumi.Cnts[bnch]; init_flag=0;}
00505       if ((SpeLumi.Cnts[bnch] < min)&&(!SpeLumi.Cnts[bnch])) min = SpeLumi.Cnts[bnch];
00506       if (max < SpeLumi.Cnts[bnch]) max = SpeLumi.Cnts[bnch];
00507    }
00508  
00509    // define rate distribution and fill the histogram
00510    ErrDet->cd();
00511    char hname[100];
00512    sprintf(hname,"%.3f : Specific Luminosiry / bunch", gMeasInfo->RUNID);
00513    bunch_spelumi = new TH1F("bunch_spelumi",hname, 100, min*0.9, max*1.1);
00514    bunch_spelumi -> GetXaxis()->SetTitle("Good 12C Events/bunch / WCM");
00515    bunch_spelumi -> GetYaxis()->SetTitle("# Bunches weighted by 1/sqrt(12C Events)");
00516  
00517    for (int bnch=0;bnch<NBUNCH;bnch++) {
00518      if ((SpeLumi.Cnts[bnch])&&(bnch!=EXCLUDE_BUNCH))
00519        bunch_spelumi->Fill(SpeLumi.Cnts[bnch], 1/SpeLumi.dCnts[bnch]);
00520    }
00521  
00522    // define rate vs. bunch plot
00523    TGraph *gr = new TGraph(NBUNCH, bindex, SpeLumi.Cnts);
00524    gr->SetMarkerSize(MSIZE);
00525    gr->SetMarkerStyle(20);
00526    gr->SetMarkerColor(4);
00527 
00528    spelumi_vs_bunch = new TH2F("spelumi_vs_bunch", hname, NBUNCH, -0.5, NBUNCH+0.5, 50, min, max*1.3);
00529    spelumi_vs_bunch -> GetListOfFunctions() -> Add(gr,"P");
00530    spelumi_vs_bunch -> GetXaxis()->SetTitle("Bunch Number");
00531    spelumi_vs_bunch -> GetYaxis()->SetTitle("12C Yields/WCM");
00532  
00533    // define gaussian function
00534    // mean (parameter-1) is constrained to be between min and max of entries
00535    // sigma (parameter-1) is constrained to be between 0 and max-min of entries
00536    TF1 * g1 = new TF1("g1","gaus");
00537    g1->SetParameters(bunch_spelumi->GetMaximum(), SpeLumi.ave, (SpeLumi.max-SpeLumi.min)/3);
00538    g1->SetParLimits(1, SpeLumi.min, SpeLumi.max);
00539    g1->SetParLimits(2, 0, SpeLumi.max-SpeLumi.min);
00540    g1->SetLineColor(2);
00541  
00542    // apply gaussian fit on specific luminosity distribution
00543    bunch_spelumi->Fit(g1);
00544  
00545    // get mean from gaussian fit
00546    float ave = g1->GetParameter(1);
00547    DrawHorizLine(spelumi_vs_bunch, -0.5, NBUNCH+0.5, ave, 1, 1, 1);
00548  
00549    // get sigma from Gaussian fit and calculate allowance limit
00550    float sigma=g1->GetParameter(2);
00551    bnchchk.rate.allowance = ave + errdet.BUNCH_RATE_SIGMA_ALLOWANCE*sigma;
00552    bnchchk.rate.sigma_over_mean = ave ? sigma/ave : -1 ;
00553  
00554    // draw lines to 1D and 2D histograms
00555    DrawHorizLine(spelumi_vs_bunch, -0.5, NBUNCH+0.5, bnchchk.rate.allowance, 2, 2, 2);
00556    DrawVertLine(bunch_spelumi, bnchchk.rate.allowance, g1->GetParameter(0), 2, 2);
00557  
00558    // anomaly bunch registration
00559    int  flag = 0;
00560    char text[16];
00561 
00562    for (int bnch=0;bnch<NBUNCH;bnch++) {
00563       if (SpeLumi.Cnts[bnch] > bnchchk.rate.allowance) {
00564          gAnaMeasResult->anomaly.bunch[gAnaMeasResult->anomaly.nbunch] = bnch;
00565          gAnaMeasResult->anomaly.nbunch++; flag++;
00566          float dev = (SpeLumi.Cnts[bnch] - ave)/sigma;
00567          bnchchk.rate.max_dev = bnchchk.rate.max_dev < dev ? dev : bnchchk.rate.max_dev ;
00568          printf("WARNING: bunch # %d yeild exeeds %6.1f sigma from average. HOT!\n", bnch, dev);
00569  
00570          // comment in h2 histogram
00571          sprintf(text,"Bunch %d",bnch);
00572          TText * t = new TText(bnch+2, SpeLumi.Cnts[bnch], text);
00573          spelumi_vs_bunch -> GetListOfFunctions()->Add(t);
00574       }
00575    }
00576  
00577    // assign error_code
00578    if (flag)
00579       gAnaMeasResult->anomaly.bunch_err_code += err_code;
00580 }
00581 
00582 
00583 // Description : converts float array x[] into integer and call RegisterAnomaly(int,...)
00584 //             :
00585 // Input       : float x[], int nx, int y[], int ny,
00586 // Return      : result of (x[]&y[]) -> array z[], and nz
00587 //
00588 void RegisterAnomaly(float x[], int nx, int y[], int ny, int z[], int &nz)
00589 {
00590    int X[nx];
00591    for (int i=0;i<nx;i++) X[i]=int(x[i]);
00592    RegisterAnomaly(X, nx, y, ny, z, nz);
00593 }
00594 
00595 // Description : Check whether anomalies are recognized or not.
00596 //             : Take AND of array x[] and y[], exclude double counting
00597 // Input       : int x[], int nx, int y[], int ny,
00598 // Return      : result of (x[]&y[]) -> array z[], and nz
00599 //
00600 void RegisterAnomaly(int x[], int nx, int y[], int ny, int z[], int &nz)
00601 {
00602    // if ny=0, then copy x[] -> z[]. the main loop doesn't work for ny=0
00603    if (!ny) {
00604       for (int i=0;i<nx;i++) z[i]=x[i];
00605       nz=nx;
00606       return;
00607    }
00608  
00609    // main loop
00610    nz=0; int J=0;
00611    for(int i=0; i<nx; i++) {
00612  
00613       for (int j=J; j<ny ; j++){
00614          if (y[j]<x[i]) {
00615             z[nz]=y[j]; nz++; J++;
00616          } else if (y[j]==x[i]) {
00617             z[nz]=y[j]; nz++; J++;
00618             break;
00619          } else {
00620             z[nz]=x[i]; nz++;
00621             break;
00622          }
00623       }
00624    }
00625  
00626    // above loop doesn't precess the largest number in x[] or y[] array
00627    if (x[nx-1]>y[ny-1]) {z[nz]=x[nx-1]; nz++;}
00628    if (y[ny-1]>x[nx-1]) {z[nz]=y[ny-1]; nz++;}
00629 }
00630 
00631 
00632 // Description : Check whether anomalies are recognized or not.
00633 //             : Take AND of array x[] and y[], returns false of the tests
00634 // Input       : int *x, int nx, int *y, int ny,
00635 // Return      : unrecongnized (strip/bunch) ID in array z, and nz
00636 void UnrecognizedAnomaly(int x[], int nx, int y[], int ny, int z[], int &nz)
00637 {
00638    int match[nx];
00639  
00640    for (int i=0; i<nx; i++) match[i] = x[i];
00641  
00642    // Check for mathing between two arrays x[nx], y[ny]
00643    for (int i=0; i<ny; i++) {
00644       for (int j=0; j<nx; j++) {
00645          if (y[i] == match[j]) { match[j]=-1; break; }
00646       }
00647    }
00648  
00649    nz = 0;
00650  
00651    for (int i=0; i<nx; i++) {
00652       if (match[i]!=-1) { z[nz] = match[i]; nz++;}
00653    }
00654 }
